text: Priargunsk () is an urban locality (an urban-type settlement) and the administrative center of Priargunsky District in Zabaykalsky Krai, Russia. Population: . ==Geography== Priargunsk is on the river Argun. It is located 595 km (by rail) to the south-east. from Chita. ==History== It was founded in 1953. On March 30, 1962, by a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the RSFSR, the working settlement of Tsurukhaitui was renamed and became the urban settlement of Priargunsk. An airport operated until the 1990s.Priargunsk in the Encyclopedia of Transbaikalia ==Economy== There is a food factory, JSC Priargunsky Cheese Factory, LLC Agropromtrans, and trucking enterprises. There is district hospital, maternity hospital, and pharmacy. ==References== Category:Urban-type settlements in Zabaykalsky Krai Category:1953 establishments in the Soviet Union
title: Priargunsk
